abstracts.cdata!:
The Fifth Highway Project consists of:
            (a) resurfacing and partial rehabilitation of about 500 km
            of paved roads and the provision of an initial stock of
            materials (bitumen) for road maintenance; (b) construction
            of bridges for the Antsohihy-Ambanja road; (c) improvement
            of road maintenance operations by strengthening MTP's
            central administrative organization for road maintenance;
            improving routine and periodic maintenance in two regional
            districts, including regravelling program for about 400 km
            of roads; and improving the mechanical workshops in five
            regional district centers; (d) a study to determine the most
            appropriate mix of labor and equipment for road maintenance
            and improvement works and implementation of a two-year
            demonstration program; (e) feasibility and detailed
            engineering studies for a 170 km section of road; (f)
            training of MTP staff by technical assistance; and (g)
            fellowships for MTP staff.
